line_text: I wonder how the king escaped our hands.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: While we pursued the horsemen of the north,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He slily stole away and left his men:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whereat the great Lord of Northumberland,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whose warlike ears could never brook retreat,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Cheer'd up the drooping army; and himself,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lord Clifford and Lord Stafford, all abreast,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Charged our main battle's front, and breaking in
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Were by the swords of common soldiers slain.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lord Stafford's father, Duke of Buckingham,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is either slain or wounded dangerously;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I cleft his beaver with a downright blow:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That this is true, father, behold his blood.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, brother, here's the Earl of Wiltshire's blood,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whom I encounter'd as the battles join'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Speak thou for me and tell them what I did.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Richard hath best deserved of all my sons.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But is your grace dead, my Lord of Somerset?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Such hope have all the line of John of Gaunt!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thus do I hope to shake King Henry's head.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And so do I. Victorious Prince of York,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Before I see thee seated in that throne
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which now the house of Lancaster usurps,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I vow by heaven these eyes shall never close.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This is the palace of the fearful king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And this the regal seat: possess it, York;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For this is thine and not King Henry's heirs'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Assist me, then, sweet Warwick, and I will;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For hither we have broken in by force.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We'll all assist you; he that flies shall die.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thanks, gentle Norfolk: stay by me, my lords;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, soldiers, stay and lodge by me this night.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And when the king comes, offer no violence,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unless he seek to thrust you out perforce.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The queen this day here holds her parliament,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But little thinks we shall be of her council:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By words or blows here let us win our right.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Arm'd as we are, let's stay within this house.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The bloody parliament shall this be call'd,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unless Plantagenet, Duke of York, be king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And bashful Henry deposed, whose cowardice
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hath made us by-words to our enemies.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then leave me not, my lords; be resolute;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I mean to take possession of my right.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Neither the king, nor he that loves him best,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The proudest he that holds up Lancaster,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Dares stir a wing, if Warwick shake his bells.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll plant Plantagenet, root him up who dares:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Resolve thee, Richard; claim the English crown.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lords, look where the sturdy rebel sits,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Even in the chair of state: belike he means,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Back'd by the power of Warwick, that false peer,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To aspire unto the crown and reign as king.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Earl of Northumberland, he slew thy father.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thine, Lord Clifford; and you both have vow'd revenge
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: On him, his sons, his favourites and his friends.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If I be not, heavens be revenged on me!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The hope thereof makes Clifford mourn in steel.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What, shall we suffer this? let's pluck him down:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My heart for anger burns; I cannot brook it.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be patient, gentle Earl of Westmoreland.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Patience is for poltroons, such as he:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He durst not sit there, had your father lived.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My gracious lord, here in the parliament
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let us assail the family of York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Well hast thou spoken, cousin: be it so.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, know you not the city favours them,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And they have troops of soldiers at their beck?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But when the duke is slain, they'll quickly fly.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Far be the thought of this from Henry's heart,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To make a shambles of the parliament-house!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Cousin of Exeter, frowns, words and threats
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall be the war that Henry means to use.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou factious Duke of York, descend my throne,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: and kneel for grace and mercy at my feet;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I am thy sovereign.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I am thine.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For shame, come down: he made thee Duke of York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Twas my inheritance, as the earldom was.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy father was a traitor to the crown.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Exeter, thou art a traitor to the crown
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In following this usurping Henry.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whom should he follow but his natural king?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: True, Clifford; and that's Richard Duke of York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And shall I stand, and thou sit in my throne?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It must and shall be so: content thyself.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be Duke of Lancaster; let him be king.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He is both king and Duke of Lancaster;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And that the Lord of Westmoreland shall maintain.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And Warwick shall disprove it. You forget
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That we are those which chased you from the field
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And slew your fathers, and with colours spread
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: March'd through the city to the palace gates.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yes, Warwick, I remember it to my grief;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, by his soul, thou and thy house shall rue it.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Plantagenet, of thee and these thy sons,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy kinsman and thy friends, I'll have more lives
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Than drops of blood were in my father's veins.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Urge it no more; lest that, instead of words,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I send thee, Warwick, such a messenger
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As shall revenge his death before I stir.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Poor Clifford! how I scorn his worthless threats!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Will you we show our title to the crown?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If not, our swords shall plead it in the field.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What title hast thou, traitor, to the crown?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy father was, as thou art, Duke of York;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy grandfather, Roger Mortimer, Earl of March:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I am the son of Henry the Fifth,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who made the Dauphin and the French to stoop
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And seized upon their towns and provinces.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Talk not of France, sith thou hast lost it all.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The lord protector lost it, and not I:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When I was crown'd I was but nine months old.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You are old enough now, and yet, methinks, you lose.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Father, tear the crown from the usurper's head.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sweet father, do so; set it on your head.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Good brother, as thou lovest and honourest arms,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let's fight it out and not stand cavilling thus.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sound drums and trumpets, and the king will fly.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sons, peace!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Peace, thou! and give King Henry leave to speak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Plantagenet shall speak first: hear him, lords;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And be you silent and attentive too,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For he that interrupts him shall not live.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Think'st thou that I will leave my kingly throne,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Wherein my grandsire and my father sat?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No: first shall war unpeople this my realm;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, and their colours, often borne in France,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And now in England to our heart's great sorrow,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall be my winding-sheet. Why faint you, lords?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My title's good, and better far than his.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Prove it, Henry, and thou shalt be king.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Henry the Fourth by conquest got the crown.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Twas by rebellion against his king.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Tell me, may not a king adopt an heir?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What then?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: An if he may, then am I lawful king;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For Richard, in the view of many lords,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Resign'd the crown to Henry the Fourth,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whose heir my father was, and I am his.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He rose against him, being his sovereign,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And made him to resign his crown perforce.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Suppose, my lords, he did it unconstrain'd,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Think you 'twere prejudicial to his crown?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No; for he could not so resign his crown
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But that the next heir should succeed and reign.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Art thou against us, Duke of Exeter?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His is the right, and therefore pardon me.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why whisper you, my lords, and answer not?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My conscience tells me he is lawful king.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Plantagenet, for all the claim thou lay'st,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Think not that Henry shall be so deposed.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Deposed he shall be, in despite of all.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou art deceived: 'tis not thy southern power,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of Essex, Norfolk, Suffolk, nor of Kent,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which makes thee thus presumptuous and proud,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Can set the duke up in despite of me.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: King Henry, be thy title right or wrong,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lord Clifford vows to fight in thy defence:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: May that ground gape and swallow me alive,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where I shall kneel to him that slew my father!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O Clifford, how thy words revive my heart!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Henry of Lancaster, resign thy crown.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What mutter you, or what conspire you, lords?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Do right unto this princely Duke of York,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or I will fill the house with armed men,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And over the chair of state, where now he sits,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Write up his title with usurping blood.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My Lord of Warwick, hear me but one word:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let me for this my life-time reign as king.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Confirm the crown to me and to mine heirs,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thou shalt reign in quiet while thou livest.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I am content: Richard Plantagenet,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Enjoy the kingdom after my decease.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What wrong is this unto the prince your son!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What good is this to England and himself!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Base, fearful and despairing Henry!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How hast thou injured both thyself and us!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I cannot stay to hear these articles.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor I.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, cousin, let us tell the queen these news.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Farewell, faint-hearted and degenerate king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In whose cold blood no spark of honour bides.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be thou a prey unto the house of York,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And die in bands for this unmanly deed!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In dreadful war mayst thou be overcome,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or live in peace abandon'd and despised!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Turn this way, Henry, and regard them not.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They seek revenge and therefore will not yield.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, Exeter!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why should you sigh, my lord?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Not for myself, Lord Warwick, but my son,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whom I unnaturally shall disinherit.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But be it as it may: I here entail
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The crown to thee and to thine heirs for ever;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Conditionally, that here thou take an oath
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To cease this civil war, and, whilst I live,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To honour me as thy king and sovereign,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And neither by treason nor hostility
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To seek to put me down and reign thyself.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This oath I willingly take and will perform.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Long live King Henry! Plantagenet embrace him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And long live thou and these thy forward sons!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now York and Lancaster are reconciled.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Accursed be he that seeks to make them foes!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Farewell, my gracious lord; I'll to my castle.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I'll keep London with my soldiers.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I to Norfolk with my followers.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I unto the sea from whence I came.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I, with grief and sorrow, to the court.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here comes the queen, whose looks bewray her anger:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll steal away.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Exeter, so will I.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nay, go not from me; I will follow thee.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be patient, gentle queen, and I will stay.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who can be patient in such extremes?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, wretched man! would I had died a maid
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And never seen thee, never borne thee son,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Seeing thou hast proved so unnatural a father
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hath he deserved to lose his birthright thus?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hadst thou but loved him half so well as I,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or felt that pain which I did for him once,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or nourish'd him as I did with my blood,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou wouldst have left thy dearest heart-blood there,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Rather than have that savage duke thine heir
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And disinherited thine only son.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Father, you cannot disinherit me:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If you be king, why should not I succeed?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Pardon me, Margaret; pardon me, sweet son:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The Earl of Warwick and the duke enforced me.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Enforced thee! art thou king, and wilt be forced?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I shame to hear thee speak. Ah, timorous wretch!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou hast undone thyself, thy son and me;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And given unto the house of York such head
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As thou shalt reign but by their sufferance.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To entail him and his heirs unto the crown,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What is it, but to make thy sepulchre
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And creep into it far before thy time?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Warwick is chancellor and the lord of Calais;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Stern Falconbridge commands the narrow seas;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The duke is made protector of the realm;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And yet shalt thou be safe? such safety finds
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The trembling lamb environed with wolves.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Had I been there, which am a silly woman,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The soldiers should have toss'd me on their pikes
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Before I would have granted to that act.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But thou preferr'st thy life before thine honour:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And seeing thou dost, I here divorce myself
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Both from thy table, Henry, and thy bed,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Until that act of parliament be repeal'd
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whereby my son is disinherited.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The northern lords that have forsworn thy colours
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Will follow mine, if once they see them spread;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And spread they shall be, to thy foul disgrace
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And utter ruin of the house of York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thus do I leave thee. Come, son, let's away;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Our army is ready; come, we'll after them.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Stay, gentle Margaret, and hear me speak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou hast spoke too much already: get thee gone.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Gentle son Edward, thou wilt stay with me?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, to be murder'd by his enemies.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When I return with victory from the field
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll see your grace: till then I'll follow her.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, son, away; we may not linger thus.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Poor queen! how love to me and to her son
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hath made her break out into terms of rage!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Revenged may she be on that hateful duke,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whose haughty spirit, winged with desire,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Will cost my crown, and like an empty eagle
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Tire on the flesh of me and of my son!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The loss of those three lords torments my heart:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll write unto them and entreat them fair.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, cousin you shall be the messenger.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I, I hope, shall reconcile them all.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Brother, though I be youngest, give me leave.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No, I can better play the orator.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But I have reasons strong and forcible.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, how now, sons and brother! at a strife?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What is your quarrel? how began it first?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No quarrel, but a slight contention.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: About what?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: About that which concerns your grace and us;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The crown of England, father, which is yours.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Mine boy? not till King Henry be dead.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Your right depends not on his life or death.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now you are heir, therefore enjoy it now:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By giving the house of Lancaster leave to breathe,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It will outrun you, father, in the end.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I took an oath that he should quietly reign.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But for a kingdom any oath may be broken:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I would break a thousand oaths to reign one year.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No; God forbid your grace should be forsworn.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I shall be, if I claim by open war.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll prove the contrary, if you'll hear me speak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou canst not, son; it is impossible.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: An oath is of no moment, being not took
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Before a true and lawful magistrate,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That hath authority over him that swears:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Henry had none, but did usurp the place;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then, seeing 'twas he that made you to depose,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Your oath, my lord, is vain and frivolous.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Therefore, to arms! And, father, do but think
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How sweet a thing it is to wear a crown;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Within whose circuit is Elysium
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And all that poets feign of bliss and joy.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why do we finger thus? I cannot rest
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Until the white rose that I wear be dyed
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Even in the lukewarm blood of Henry's heart.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Richard, enough; I will be king, or die.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Brother, thou shalt to London presently,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And whet on Warwick to this enterprise.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou, Richard, shalt to the Duke of Norfolk,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And tell him privily of our intent.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You Edward, shall unto my Lord Cobham,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With whom the Kentishmen will willingly rise:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In them I trust; for they are soldiers,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Witty, courteous, liberal, full of spirit.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: While you are thus employ'd, what resteth more,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But that I seek occasion how to rise,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And yet the king not privy to my drift,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor any of the house of Lancaster?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, stay: what news? Why comest thou in such post?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The queen with all the northern earls and lords
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Intend here to besiege you in your castle:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She is hard by with twenty thousand men;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And therefore fortify your hold, my lord.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, with my sword. What! think'st thou that we fear them?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Edward and Richard, you shall stay with me;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My brother Montague shall post to London:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let noble Warwick, Cobham, and the rest,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whom we have left protectors of the king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With powerful policy strengthen themselves,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And trust not simple Henry nor his oaths.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Brother, I go; I'll win them, fear it not:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thus most humbly I do take my leave.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sir John and Sir Hugh Mortimer, mine uncles,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You are come to Sandal in a happy hour;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The army of the queen mean to besiege us.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She shall not need; we'll meet her in the field.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What, with five thousand men?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, with five hundred, father, for a need:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A woman's general; what should we fear?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I hear their drums: let's set our men in order,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And issue forth and bid them battle straight.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Five men to twenty! though the odds be great,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I doubt not, uncle, of our victory.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Many a battle have I won in France,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When as the enemy hath been ten to one:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why should I not now have the like success?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, whither shall I fly to 'scape their hands?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Ah, tutor, look where bloody Clifford comes!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Chaplain, away! thy priesthood saves thy life.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: As for the brat of this accursed duke,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Whose father slew my father, he shall die.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: And I, my lord, will bear him company.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Soldiers, away with him!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Ah, Clifford, murder not this innocent child,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Lest thou be hated both of God and man!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: How now! is he dead already? or is it fear
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: That makes him close his eyes? I'll open them.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: So looks the pent-up lion o'er the wretch
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: That trembles under his devouring paws;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: And so he walks, insulting o'er his prey,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: And so he comes, to rend his limbs asunder.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Ah, gentle Clifford, kill me with thy sword,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: And not with such a cruel threatening look.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Sweet Clifford, hear me speak before I die.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: I am too mean a subject for thy wrath:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Be thou revenged on men, and let me live.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: In vain thou speak'st, poor boy; my father's blood
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Hath stopp'd the passage where thy words should enter.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Then let my father's blood open it again:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: He is a man, and, Clifford, cope with him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Had thy brethren here, their lives and thine
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Were not revenge sufficient for me;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: No, if I digg'd up thy forefathers' graves
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: And hung their rotten coffins up in chains,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: It could not slake mine ire, nor ease my heart.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: The sight of any of the house of York
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Is as a fury to torment my soul;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: And till I root out their accursed line
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: And leave not one alive, I live in hell.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Therefore--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: O, let me pray before I take my death!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: To thee I pray; sweet Clifford, pity me!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Such pity as my rapier's point affords.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: I never did thee harm: why wilt thou slay me?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Thy father hath.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: But 'twas ere I was born.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Thou hast one son; for his sake pity me,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Lest in revenge thereof, sith God is just,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: He be as miserably slain as I.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Ah, let me live in prison all my days;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: And when I give occasion of offence,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Then let me die, for now thou hast no cause.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: No cause!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Thy father slew my father; therefore, die.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Di faciant laudis summa sit ista tuae!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Plantagenet! I come, Plantagenet!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: And this thy son's blood cleaving to my blade
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Shall rust upon my weapon, till thy blood,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: Congeal'd with this, do make me wipe off both.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Field of battle betwixt Sandal Castle and Wakefield.

line_text: The army of the queen hath got the field:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: My uncles both are slain in rescuing me;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And all my followers to the eager foe
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Turn back and fly, like ships before the wind
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Or lambs pursued by hunger-starved wolves.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: My sons, God knows what hath bechanced them:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But this I know, they have demean'd themselves
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Like men born to renown by life or death.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Three times did Richard make a lane to me.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And thrice cried 'Courage, father! fight it out!'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And full as oft came Edward to my side,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: With purple falchion, painted to the hilt
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: In blood of those that had encounter'd him:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And when the hardiest warriors did retire,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Richard cried 'Charge! and give no foot of ground!'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And cried 'A crown, or else a glorious tomb!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: A sceptre, or an earthly sepulchre!'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: With this, we charged again: but, out, alas!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: We bodged again; as I have seen a swan
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: With bootless labour swim against the tide
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And spend her strength with over-matching waves.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ah, hark! the fatal followers do pursue;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And I am faint and cannot fly their fury:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And were I strong, I would not shun their fury:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The sands are number'd that make up my life;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Here must I stay, and here my life must end.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Come, bloody Clifford, rough Northumberland,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I dare your quenchless fury to more rage:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I am your butt, and I abide your shot.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Yield to our mercy, proud Plantagenet.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ay, to such mercy as his ruthless arm,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: With downright payment, show'd unto my father.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Now Phaethon hath tumbled from his car,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And made an evening at the noontide prick.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: My ashes, as the phoenix, may bring forth
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: A bird that will revenge upon you all:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And in that hope I throw mine eyes to heaven,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Scorning whate'er you can afflict me with.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Why come you not? what! multitudes, and fear?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So cowards fight when they can fly no further;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So doves do peck the falcon's piercing talons;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So desperate thieves, all hopeless of their lives,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Breathe out invectives 'gainst the officers.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O Clifford, but bethink thee once again,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And in thy thought o'er-run my former time;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And, if though canst for blushing, view this face,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And bite thy tongue, that slanders him with cowardice
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Whose frown hath made thee faint and fly ere this!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I will not bandy with thee word for word,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But buckle with thee blows, twice two for one.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hold, valiant Clifford! for a thousand causes
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I would prolong awhile the traitor's life.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Wrath makes him deaf: speak thou, Northumberland.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hold, Clifford! do not honour him so much
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To prick thy finger, though to wound his heart:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What valour were it, when a cur doth grin,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For one to thrust his hand between his teeth,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: When he might spurn him with his foot away?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: It is war's prize to take all vantages;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And ten to one is no impeach of valour.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ay, ay, so strives the woodcock with the gin.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So doth the cony struggle in the net.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So triumph thieves upon their conquer'd booty;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So true men yield, with robbers so o'ermatch'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What would your grace have done unto him now?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Brave warriors, Clifford and Northumberland,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Come, make him stand upon this molehill here,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That raught at mountains with outstretched arms,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Yet parted but the shadow with his hand.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What! was it you that would be England's king?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Was't you that revell'd in our parliament,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And made a preachment of your high descent?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Where are your mess of sons to back you now?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The wanton Edward, and the lusty George?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And where's that valiant crook-back prodigy,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Dicky your boy, that with his grumbling voice
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Was wont to cheer his dad in mutinies?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Or, with the rest, where is your darling Rutland?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Look, York: I stain'd this napkin with the blood
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That valiant Clifford, with his rapier's point,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Made issue from the bosom of the boy;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And if thine eyes can water for his death,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I give thee this to dry thy cheeks withal.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Alas poor York! but that I hate thee deadly,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I should lament thy miserable state.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I prithee, grieve, to make me merry, York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What, hath thy fiery heart so parch'd thine entrails
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That not a tear can fall for Rutland's death?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Why art thou patient, man? thou shouldst be mad;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And I, to make thee mad, do mock thee thus.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Stamp, rave, and fret, that I may sing and dance.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thou wouldst be fee'd, I see, to make me sport:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: York cannot speak, unless he wear a crown.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: A crown for York! and, lords, bow low to him:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hold you his hands, whilst I do set it on.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ay, marry, sir, now looks he like a king!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ay, this is he that took King Henry's chair,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And this is he was his adopted heir.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But how is it that great Plantagenet
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Is crown'd so soon, and broke his solemn oath?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: As I bethink me, you should not be king
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Till our King Henry had shook hands with death.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And will you pale your head in Henry's glory,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And rob his temples of the diadem,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Now in his life, against your holy oath?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O, 'tis a fault too too unpardonable!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Off with the crown, and with the crown his head;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And, whilst we breathe, take time to do him dead.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That is my office, for my father's sake.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Nay, stay; lets hear the orisons he makes.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: She-wolf of France, but worse than wolves of France,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Whose tongue more poisons than the adder's tooth!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: How ill-beseeming is it in thy sex
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To triumph, like an Amazonian trull,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Upon their woes whom fortune captivates!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But that thy face is, vizard-like, unchanging,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Made impudent with use of evil deeds,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I would assay, proud queen, to make thee blush.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To tell thee whence thou camest, of whom derived,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Were shame enough to shame thee, wert thou not shameless.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thy father bears the type of King of Naples,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Of both the Sicils and Jerusalem,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Yet not so wealthy as an English yeoman.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hath that poor monarch taught thee to insult?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: It needs not, nor it boots thee not, proud queen,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Unless the adage must be verified,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That beggars mounted run their horse to death.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: 'Tis beauty that doth oft make women proud;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But, God he knows, thy share thereof is small:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: 'Tis virtue that doth make them most admired;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The contrary doth make thee wonder'd at:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: 'Tis government that makes them seem divine;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The want thereof makes thee abominable:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thou art as opposite to every good
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: As the Antipodes are unto us,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Or as the south to the septentrion.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O tiger's heart wrapt in a woman's hide!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: How couldst thou drain the life-blood of the child,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To bid the father wipe his eyes withal,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And yet be seen to bear a woman's face?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Women are soft, mild, pitiful and flexible;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thou stern, obdurate, flinty, rough, remorseless.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Bids't thou me rage? why, now thou hast thy wish:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Wouldst have me weep? why, now thou hast thy will:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For raging wind blows up incessant showers,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And when the rage allays, the rain begins.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: These tears are my sweet Rutland's obsequies:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And every drop cries vengeance for his death,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: 'Gainst thee, fell Clifford, and thee, false
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Frenchwoman.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Beshrew me, but his passion moves me so
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That hardly can I cheque my eyes from tears.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That face of his the hungry cannibals
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Would not have touch'd, would not have stain'd with blood:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But you are more inhuman, more inexorable,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O, ten times more, than tigers of Hyrcania.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: See, ruthless queen, a hapless father's tears:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: This cloth thou dip'dst in blood of my sweet boy,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And I with tears do wash the blood away.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Keep thou the napkin, and go boast of this:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And if thou tell'st the heavy story right,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Upon my soul, the hearers will shed tears;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Yea even my foes will shed fast-falling tears,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And say 'Alas, it was a piteous deed!'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: There, take the crown, and, with the crown, my curse;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And in thy need such comfort come to thee
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: As now I reap at thy too cruel hand!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hard-hearted Clifford, take me from the world:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: My soul to heaven, my blood upon your heads!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Had he been slaughter-man to all my kin,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I should not for my life but weep with him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To see how inly sorrow gripes his soul.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What, weeping-ripe, my Lord Northumberland?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Think but upon the wrong he did us all,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And that will quickly dry thy melting tears.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Here's for my oath, here's for my father's death.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And here's to right our gentle-hearted king.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Open Thy gate of mercy, gracious God!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: My soul flies through these wounds to seek out Thee.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Off with his head, and set it on York gates;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So York may overlook the town of York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I wonder how our princely father 'scaped,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Or whether he be 'scaped away or no
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: From Clifford's and Northumberland's pursuit:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Had he been ta'en, we should have heard the news;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Had he been slain, we should have heard the news;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Or had he 'scaped, methinks we should have heard
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: The happy tidings of his good escape.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: How fares my brother? why is he so sad?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: I cannot joy, until I be resolved
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Where our right valiant father is become.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: I saw him in the battle range about;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And watch'd him how he singled Clifford forth.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Methought he bore him in the thickest troop
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: As doth a lion in a herd of neat;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Or as a bear, encompass'd round with dogs,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Who having pinch'd a few and made them cry,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: The rest stand all aloof, and bark at him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: So fared our father with his enemies;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: So fled his enemies my warlike father:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Methinks, 'tis prize enough to be his son.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: See how the morning opes her golden gates,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And takes her farewell of the glorious sun!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: How well resembles it the prime of youth,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Trimm'd like a younker prancing to his love!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Dazzle mine eyes, or do I see three suns?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Three glorious suns, each one a perfect sun;
