play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Not separated with the racking clouds,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: But sever'd in a pale clear-shining sky.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: See, see! they join, embrace, and seem to kiss,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: As if they vow'd some league inviolable:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Now are they but one lamp, one light, one sun.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: In this the heaven figures some event.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: 'Tis wondrous strange, the like yet never heard of.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: I think it cites us, brother, to the field,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: That we, the sons of brave Plantagenet,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Each one already blazing by our meeds,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Should notwithstanding join our lights together
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And over-shine the earth as this the world.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Whate'er it bodes, henceforward will I bear
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Upon my target three fair-shining suns.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Nay, bear three daughters: by your leave I speak it,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: You love the breeder better than the male.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: But what art thou, whose heavy looks foretell
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Some dreadful story hanging on thy tongue?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Ah, one that was a woful looker-on
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: When as the noble Duke of York was slain,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Your princely father and my loving lord!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: O, speak no more, for I have heard too much.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Say how he died, for I will hear it all.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Environed he was with many foes,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And stood against them, as the hope of Troy
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Against the Greeks that would have enter'd Troy.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: But Hercules himself must yield to odds;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And many strokes, though with a little axe,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Hew down and fell the hardest-timber'd oak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: By many hands your father was subdued;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: But only slaughter'd by the ireful arm
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Of unrelenting Clifford and the queen,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Who crown'd the gracious duke in high despite,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Laugh'd in his face; and when with grief he wept,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: The ruthless queen gave him to dry his cheeks
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: A napkin steeped in the harmless blood
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Of sweet young Rutland, by rough Clifford slain:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And after many scorns, many foul taunts,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: They took his head, and on the gates of York
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: They set the same; and there it doth remain,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: The saddest spectacle that e'er I view'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Sweet Duke of York, our prop to lean upon,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Now thou art gone, we have no staff, no stay.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: O Clifford, boisterous Clifford! thou hast slain
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: The flower of Europe for his chivalry;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And treacherously hast thou vanquish'd him,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: For hand to hand he would have vanquish'd thee.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Now my soul's palace is become a prison:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Ah, would she break from hence, that this my body
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Might in the ground be closed up in rest!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: For never henceforth shall I joy again,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Never, O never shall I see more joy!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: I cannot weep; for all my body's moisture
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Scarce serves to quench my furnace-burning heart:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Nor can my tongue unload my heart's great burthen;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: For selfsame wind that I should speak withal
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Is kindling coals that fires all my breast,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And burns me up with flames that tears would quench.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: To weep is to make less the depth of grief:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Tears then for babes; blows and revenge for me
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Richard, I bear thy name; I'll venge thy death,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Or die renowned by attempting it.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: His name that valiant duke hath left with thee;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: His dukedom and his chair with me is left.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Nay, if thou be that princely eagle's bird,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Show thy descent by gazing 'gainst the sun:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: For chair and dukedom, throne and kingdom say;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Either that is thine, or else thou wert not his.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: How now, fair lords! What fare? what news abroad?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Great Lord of Warwick, if we should recount
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Our baleful news, and at each word's deliverance
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Stab poniards in our flesh till all were told,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: The words would add more anguish than the wounds.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: O valiant lord, the Duke of York is slain!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: O Warwick, Warwick! that Plantagenet,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Which held three dearly as his soul's redemption,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Is by the stern Lord Clifford done to death.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Ten days ago I drown'd these news in tears;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And now, to add more measure to your woes,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: I come to tell you things sith then befall'n.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: After the bloody fray at Wakefield fought,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Where your brave father breathed his latest gasp,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Tidings, as swiftly as the posts could run,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Were brought me of your loss and his depart.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: I, then in London keeper of the king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Muster'd my soldiers, gather'd flocks of friends,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And very well appointed, as I thought,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: March'd toward Saint Alban's to intercept the queen,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Bearing the king in my behalf along;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: For by my scouts I was advertised
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: That she was coming with a full intent
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: To dash our late decree in parliament
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Touching King Henry's oath and your succession.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Short tale to make, we at Saint Alban's met
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Our battles join'd, and both sides fiercely fought:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: But whether 'twas the coldness of the king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Who look'd full gently on his warlike queen,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: That robb'd my soldiers of their heated spleen;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Or whether 'twas report of her success;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Or more than common fear of Clifford's rigour,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Who thunders to his captives blood and death,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: I cannot judge: but to conclude with truth,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Their weapons like to lightning came and went;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Our soldiers', like the night-owl's lazy flight,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Or like an idle thresher with a flail,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Fell gently down, as if they struck their friends.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: I cheer'd them up with justice of our cause,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: With promise of high pay and great rewards:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: But all in vain; they had no heart to fight,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And we in them no hope to win the day;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: So that we fled; the king unto the queen;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Lord George your brother, Norfolk and myself,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: In haste, post-haste, are come to join with you:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: For in the marches here we heard you were,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Making another head to fight again.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Where is the Duke of Norfolk, gentle Warwick?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And when came George from Burgundy to England?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Some six miles off the duke is with the soldiers;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And for your brother, he was lately sent
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: From your kind aunt, Duchess of Burgundy,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: With aid of soldiers to this needful war.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: 'Twas odds, belike, when valiant Warwick fled:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Oft have I heard his praises in pursuit,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: But ne'er till now his scandal of retire.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Nor now my scandal, Richard, dost thou hear;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: For thou shalt know this strong right hand of mine
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Can pluck the diadem from faint Henry's head,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And wring the awful sceptre from his fist,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Were he as famous and as bold in war
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: As he is famed for mildness, peace, and prayer.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: I know it well, Lord Warwick; blame me not:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: 'Tis love I bear thy glories makes me speak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: But in this troublous time what's to be done?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Shall we go throw away our coats of steel,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And wrap our bodies in black mourning gowns,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Numbering our Ave-Maries with our beads?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Or shall we on the helmets of our foes
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Tell our devotion with revengeful arms?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: If for the last, say ay, and to it, lords.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Why, therefore Warwick came to seek you out;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And therefore comes my brother Montague.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Attend me, lords. The proud insulting queen,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: With Clifford and the haught Northumberland,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And of their feather many more proud birds,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Have wrought the easy-melting king like wax.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: He swore consent to your succession,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: His oath enrolled in the parliament;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And now to London all the crew are gone,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: To frustrate both his oath and what beside
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: May make against the house of Lancaster.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Their power, I think, is thirty thousand strong:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Now, if the help of Norfolk and myself,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: With all the friends that thou, brave Earl of March,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Amongst the loving Welshmen canst procure,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Will but amount to five and twenty thousand,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Why, Via! to London will we march amain,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And once again bestride our foaming steeds,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And once again cry 'Charge upon our foes!'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: But never once again turn back and fly.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Ay, now methinks I hear great Warwick speak:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Ne'er may he live to see a sunshine day,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: That cries 'Retire,' if Warwick bid him stay.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Lord Warwick, on thy shoulder will I lean;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And when thou fail'st--as God forbid the hour!--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Must Edward fall, which peril heaven forfend!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: No longer Earl of March, but Duke of York:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: The next degree is England's royal throne;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: For King of England shalt thou be proclaim'd
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: In every borough as we pass along;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And he that throws not up his cap for joy
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Shall for the fault make forfeit of his head.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: King Edward, valiant Richard, Montague,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Stay we no longer, dreaming of renown,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: But sound the trumpets, and about our task.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Then, Clifford, were thy heart as hard as steel,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: As thou hast shown it flinty by thy deeds,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: I come to pierce it, or to give thee mine.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Then strike up drums: God and Saint George for us!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: How now! what news?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: The Duke of Norfolk sends you word by me,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: The queen is coming with a puissant host;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: And craves your company for speedy counsel.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Why then it sorts, brave warriors, let's away.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A plain near Mortimer's Cross in Herefordshire.

line_text: Welcome, my lord, to this brave town of York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yonder's the head of that arch-enemy
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That sought to be encompass'd with your crown:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Doth not the object cheer your heart, my lord?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, as the rocks cheer them that fear their wreck:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To see this sight, it irks my very soul.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Withhold revenge, dear God! 'tis not my fault,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor wittingly have I infringed my vow.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My gracious liege, this too much lenity
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And harmful pity must be laid aside.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To whom do lions cast their gentle looks?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Not to the beast that would usurp their den.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whose hand is that the forest bear doth lick?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Not his that spoils her young before her face.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who 'scapes the lurking serpent's mortal sting?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Not he that sets his foot upon her back.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The smallest worm will turn being trodden on,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And doves will peck in safeguard of their brood.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ambitious York doth level at thy crown,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou smiling while he knit his angry brows:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He, but a duke, would have his son a king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And raise his issue, like a loving sire;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou, being a king, blest with a goodly son,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Didst yield consent to disinherit him,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which argued thee a most unloving father.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unreasonable creatures feed their young;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And though man's face be fearful to their eyes,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet, in protection of their tender ones,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who hath not seen them, even with those wings
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which sometime they have used with fearful flight,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Make war with him that climb'd unto their nest,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Offer their own lives in their young's defence?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For shame, my liege, make them your precedent!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Were it not pity that this goodly boy
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Should lose his birthright by his father's fault,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And long hereafter say unto his child,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'What my great-grandfather and his grandsire got
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My careless father fondly gave away'?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, what a shame were this! Look on the boy;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And let his manly face, which promiseth
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Successful fortune, steel thy melting heart
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To hold thine own and leave thine own with him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Full well hath Clifford play'd the orator,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Inferring arguments of mighty force.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, Clifford, tell me, didst thou never hear
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That things ill-got had ever bad success?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And happy always was it for that son
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whose father for his hoarding went to hell?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll leave my son my virtuous deeds behind;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And would my father had left me no more!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For all the rest is held at such a rate
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As brings a thousand-fold more care to keep
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Than in possession and jot of pleasure.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, cousin York! would thy best friends did know
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How it doth grieve me that thy head is here!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lord, cheer up your spirits: our foes are nigh,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And this soft courage makes your followers faint.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You promised knighthood to our forward son:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unsheathe your sword, and dub him presently.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Edward, kneel down.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Edward Plantagenet, arise a knight;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And learn this lesson, draw thy sword in right.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My gracious father, by your kingly leave,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll draw it as apparent to the crown,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And in that quarrel use it to the death.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, that is spoken like a toward prince.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Royal commanders, be in readiness:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For with a band of thirty thousand men
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Comes Warwick, backing of the Duke of York;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And in the towns, as they do march along,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Proclaims him king, and many fly to him:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Darraign your battle, for they are at hand.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I would your highness would depart the field:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The queen hath best success when you are absent.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, good my lord, and leave us to our fortune.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, that's my fortune too; therefore I'll stay.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be it with resolution then to fight.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My royal father, cheer these noble lords
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And hearten those that fight in your defence:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unsheathe your sword, good father; cry 'Saint George!'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, perjured Henry! wilt thou kneel for grace,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And set thy diadem upon my head;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or bide the mortal fortune of the field?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Go, rate thy minions, proud insulting boy!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Becomes it thee to be thus bold in terms
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Before thy sovereign and thy lawful king?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I am his king, and he should bow his knee;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I was adopted heir by his consent:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Since when, his oath is broke; for, as I hear,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You, that are king, though he do wear the crown,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have caused him, by new act of parliament,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To blot out me, and put his own son in.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And reason too:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who should succeed the father but the son?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Are you there, butcher? O, I cannot speak!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, crook-back, here I stand to answer thee,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or any he the proudest of thy sort.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Twas you that kill'd young Rutland, was it not?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, and old York, and yet not satisfied.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For God's sake, lords, give signal to the fight.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What say'st thou, Henry, wilt thou yield the crown?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, how now, long-tongued Warwick! dare you speak?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When you and I met at Saint Alban's last,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Your legs did better service than your hands.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then 'twas my turn to fly, and now 'tis thine.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You said so much before, and yet you fled.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Twas not your valour, Clifford, drove me thence.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No, nor your manhood that durst make you stay.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Northumberland, I hold thee reverently.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Break off the parley; for scarce I can refrain
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The execution of my big-swoln heart
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Upon that Clifford, that cruel child-killer.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I slew thy father, call'st thou him a child?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, like a dastard and a treacherous coward,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As thou didst kill our tender brother Rutland;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But ere sunset I'll make thee curse the deed.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have done with words, my lords, and hear me speak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Defy them then, or else hold close thy lips.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I prithee, give no limits to my tongue:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I am a king, and privileged to speak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My liege, the wound that bred this meeting here
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Cannot be cured by words; therefore be still.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then, executioner, unsheathe thy sword:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By him that made us all, I am resolved
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: that Clifford's manhood lies upon his tongue.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Say, Henry, shall I have my right, or no?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A thousand men have broke their fasts to-day,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That ne'er shall dine unless thou yield the crown.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If thou deny, their blood upon thy head;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For York in justice puts his armour on.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If that be right which Warwick says is right,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: There is no wrong, but every thing is right.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whoever got thee, there thy mother stands;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For, well I wot, thou hast thy mother's tongue.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But thou art neither like thy sire nor dam;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But like a foul mis-shapen stigmatic,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Mark'd by the destinies to be avoided,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As venom toads, or lizards' dreadful stings.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Iron of Naples hid with English gilt,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whose father bears the title of a king,--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As if a channel should be call'd the sea,--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shamest thou not, knowing whence thou art extraught,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To let thy tongue detect thy base-born heart?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A wisp of straw were worth a thousand crowns,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To make this shameless callet know herself.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Helen of Greece was fairer far than thou,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Although thy husband may be Menelaus;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And ne'er was Agamemnon's brother wrong'd
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By that false woman, as this king by thee.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His father revell'd in the heart of France,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And tamed the king, and made the dauphin stoop;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And had he match'd according to his state,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He might have kept that glory to this day;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But when he took a beggar to his bed,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And graced thy poor sire with his bridal-day,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Even then that sunshine brew'd a shower for him,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That wash'd his father's fortunes forth of France,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And heap'd sedition on his crown at home.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For what hath broach'd this tumult but thy pride?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hadst thou been meek, our title still had slept;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And we, in pity of the gentle king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Had slipp'd our claim until another age.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But when we saw our sunshine made thy spring,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And that thy summer bred us no increase,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We set the axe to thy usurping root;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And though the edge hath something hit ourselves,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet, know thou, since we have begun to strike,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We'll never leave till we have hewn thee down,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or bathed thy growing with our heated bloods.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, in this resolution, I defy thee;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Not willing any longer conference,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Since thou deniest the gentle king to speak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sound trumpets! let our bloody colours wave!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And either victory, or else a grave.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Stay, Edward.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No, wrangling woman, we'll no longer stay:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: These words will cost ten thousand lives this day.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Forspent with toil, as runners with a race,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: I lay me down a little while to breathe;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: For strokes received, and many blows repaid,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Have robb'd my strong-knit sinews of their strength,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: And spite of spite needs must I rest awhile.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Smile, gentle heaven! or strike, ungentle death!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: For this world frowns, and Edward's sun is clouded.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: How now, my lord! what hap? what hope of good?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Our hap is loss, our hope but sad despair;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Our ranks are broke, and ruin follows us:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: What counsel give you? whither shall we fly?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Bootless is flight, they follow us with wings;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: And weak we are and cannot shun pursuit.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Ah, Warwick, why hast thou withdrawn thyself?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Thy brother's blood the thirsty earth hath drunk,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Broach'd with the steely point of Clifford's lance;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: And in the very pangs of death he cried,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Like to a dismal clangour heard from far,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: 'Warwick, revenge! brother, revenge my death!'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: So, underneath the belly of their steeds,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: That stain'd their fetlocks in his smoking blood,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: The noble gentleman gave up the ghost.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Then let the earth be drunken with our blood:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: I'll kill my horse, because I will not fly.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Why stand we like soft-hearted women here,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Wailing our losses, whiles the foe doth rage;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: And look upon, as if the tragedy
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Were play'd in jest by counterfeiting actors?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Here on my knee I vow to God above,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: I'll never pause again, never stand still,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Till either death hath closed these eyes of mine
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Or fortune given me measure of revenge.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: O Warwick, I do bend my knee with thine;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: And in this vow do chain my soul to thine!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: And, ere my knee rise from the earth's cold face,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: I throw my hands, mine eyes, my heart to thee,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Thou setter up and plucker down of kings,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Beseeching thee, if with they will it stands
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: That to my foes this body must be prey,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Yet that thy brazen gates of heaven may ope,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: And give sweet passage to my sinful soul!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Now, lords, take leave until we meet again,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Where'er it be, in heaven or in earth.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Brother, give me thy hand; and, gentle Warwick,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Let me embrace thee in my weary arms:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: I, that did never weep, now melt with woe
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: That winter should cut off our spring-time so.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Away, away! Once more, sweet lords farewell.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Yet let us all together to our troops,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: And give them leave to fly that will not stay;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: And call them pillars that will stand to us;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: And, if we thrive, promise them such rewards
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: As victors wear at the Olympian games:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: This may plant courage in their quailing breasts;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: For yet is hope of life and victory.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Forslow no longer, make we hence amain.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  A field of battle between Towton and Saxton, in Yorkshire.

line_text: Now, Clifford, I have singled thee alone:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Suppose this arm is for the Duke of York,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And this for Rutland; both bound to revenge,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Wert thou environ'd with a brazen wall.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Now, Richard, I am with thee here alone:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: This is the hand that stabb'd thy father York;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And this the hand that slew thy brother Rutland;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And here's the heart that triumphs in their death
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And cheers these hands that slew thy sire and brother
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To execute the like upon thyself;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And so, have at thee!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Nay Warwick, single out some other chase;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For I myself will hunt this wolf to death.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.

line_text: This battle fares like to the morning's war,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: When dying clouds contend with growing light,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What time the shepherd, blowing of his nails,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Can neither call it perfect day nor night.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Now sways it this way, like a mighty sea
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Forced by the tide to combat with the wind;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Now sways it that way, like the selfsame sea
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Forced to retire by fury of the wind:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Sometime the flood prevails, and then the wind;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Now one the better, then another best;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Both tugging to be victors, breast to breast,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Yet neither conqueror nor conquered:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So is the equal of this fell war.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Here on this molehill will I sit me down.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To whom God will, there be the victory!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For Margaret my queen, and Clifford too,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Have chid me from the battle; swearing both
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: They prosper best of all when I am thence.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Would I were dead! if God's good will were so;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For what is in this world but grief and woe?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O God! methinks it were a happy life,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To be no better than a homely swain;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To sit upon a hill, as I do now,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To carve out dials quaintly, point by point,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thereby to see the minutes how they run,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: How many make the hour full complete;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: How many hours bring about the day;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: How many days will finish up the year;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: How many years a mortal man may live.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: When this is known, then to divide the times:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So many hours must I tend my flock;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So many hours must I take my rest;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So many hours must I contemplate;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So many hours must I sport myself;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So many days my ewes have been with young;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So many weeks ere the poor fools will ean:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So many years ere I shall shear the fleece:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So minutes, hours, days, months, and years,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Pass'd over to the end they were created,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Would bring white hairs unto a quiet grave.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ah, what a life were this! how sweet! how lovely!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Gives not the hawthorn-bush a sweeter shade
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To shepherds looking on their silly sheep,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Than doth a rich embroider'd canopy
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To kings that fear their subjects' treachery?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O, yes, it doth; a thousand-fold it doth.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And to conclude, the shepherd's homely curds,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: His cold thin drink out of his leather bottle.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: His wonted sleep under a fresh tree's shade,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: All which secure and sweetly he enjoys,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Is far beyond a prince's delicates,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: His viands sparkling in a golden cup,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: His body couched in a curious bed,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: When care, mistrust, and treason waits on him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ill blows the wind that profits nobody.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: This man, whom hand to hand I slew in fight,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: May be possessed with some store of crowns;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And I, that haply take them from him now,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: May yet ere night yield both my life and them
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To some man else, as this dead man doth me.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Who's this? O God! it is my father's face,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Whom in this conflict I unwares have kill'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O heavy times, begetting such events!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: From London by the king was I press'd forth;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: My father, being the Earl of Warwick's man,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Came on the part of York, press'd by his master;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And I, who at his hands received my life, him
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Have by my hands of life bereaved him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Pardon me, God, I knew not what I did!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And pardon, father, for I knew not thee!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: My tears shall wipe away these bloody marks;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And no more words till they have flow'd their fill.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O piteous spectacle! O bloody times!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Whiles lions war and battle for their dens,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Poor harmless lambs abide their enmity.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Weep, wretched man, I'll aid thee tear for tear;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And let our hearts and eyes, like civil war,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Be blind with tears, and break o'ercharged with grief.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thou that so stoutly hast resisted me,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Give me thy gold, if thou hast any gold:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For I have bought it with an hundred blows.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But let me see: is this our foeman's face?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ah, no, no, no, it is mine only son!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ah, boy, if any life be left in thee,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Throw up thine eye! see, see what showers arise,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Blown with the windy tempest of my heart,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Upon thy words, that kill mine eye and heart!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O, pity, God, this miserable age!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What stratagems, how fell, how butcherly,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Erroneous, mutinous and unnatural,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: This deadly quarrel daily doth beget!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O boy, thy father gave thee life too soon,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And hath bereft thee of thy life too late!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Woe above woe! grief more than common grief!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O that my death would stay these ruthful deeds!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O pity, pity, gentle heaven, pity!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The red rose and the white are on his face,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The fatal colours of our striving houses:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
