play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: This proveth Edward's love and Warwick's honesty.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: King Lewis, I here protest, in sight of heaven,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And by the hope I have of heavenly bliss,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: That I am clear from this misdeed of Edward's,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: No more my king, for he dishonours me,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: But most himself, if he could see his shame.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Did I forget that by the house of York
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: My father came untimely to his death?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Did I let pass the abuse done to my niece?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Did I impale him with the regal crown?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Did I put Henry from his native right?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And am I guerdon'd at the last with shame?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Shame on himself! for my desert is honour:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And to repair my honour lost for him,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: I here renounce him and return to Henry.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: My noble queen, let former grudges pass,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And henceforth I am thy true servitor:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: I will revenge his wrong to Lady Bona,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And replant Henry in his former state.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Warwick, these words have turn'd my hate to love;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And I forgive and quite forget old faults,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And joy that thou becomest King Henry's friend.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: So much his friend, ay, his unfeigned friend,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: That, if King Lewis vouchsafe to furnish us
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: With some few bands of chosen soldiers,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: I'll undertake to land them on our coast
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And force the tyrant from his seat by war.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: 'Tis not his new-made bride shall succor him:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And as for Clarence, as my letters tell me,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: He's very likely now to fall from him,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: For matching more for wanton lust than honour,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Or than for strength and safety of our country.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Dear brother, how shall Bona be revenged
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: But by thy help to this distressed queen?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Renowned prince, how shall poor Henry live,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Unless thou rescue him from foul despair?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: My quarrel and this English queen's are one.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And mine, fair lady Bona, joins with yours.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And mine with hers, and thine, and Margaret's.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Therefore at last I firmly am resolved
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: You shall have aid.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Let me give humble thanks for all at once.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Then, England's messenger, return in post,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And tell false Edward, thy supposed king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: That Lewis of France is sending over masquers
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: To revel it with him and his new bride:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Thou seest what's past, go fear thy king withal.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Tell him, in hope he'll prove a widower shortly,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: I'll wear the willow garland for his sake.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Tell him, my mourning weeds are laid aside,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And I am ready to put armour on.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Tell him from me that he hath done me wrong,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And therefore I'll uncrown him ere't be long.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: There's thy reward: be gone.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: But, Warwick,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Thou and Oxford, with five thousand men,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Shall cross the seas, and bid false Edward battle;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And, as occasion serves, this noble queen
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And prince shall follow with a fresh supply.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Yet, ere thou go, but answer me one doubt,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: What pledge have we of thy firm loyalty?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: This shall assure my constant loyalty,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: That if our queen and this young prince agree,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: I'll join mine eldest daughter and my joy
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: To him forthwith in holy wedlock bands.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Yes, I agree, and thank you for your motion.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Son Edward, she is fair and virtuous,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Therefore delay not, give thy hand to Warwick;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And, with thy hand, thy faith irrevocable,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: That only Warwick's daughter shall be thine.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Yes, I accept her, for she well deserves it;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And here, to pledge my vow, I give my hand.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Why stay we now? These soldiers shall be levied,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And thou, Lord Bourbon, our high admiral,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Shalt waft them over with our royal fleet.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: I long till Edward fall by war's mischance,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: For mocking marriage with a dame of France.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: I came from Edward as ambassador,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: But I return his sworn and mortal foe:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Matter of marriage was the charge he gave me,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: But dreadful war shall answer his demand.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Had he none else to make a stale but me?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Then none but I shall turn his jest to sorrow.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: I was the chief that raised him to the crown,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: And I'll be chief to bring him down again:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Not that I pity Henry's misery,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: But seek revenge on Edward's mockery.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  France. KING LEWIS XI's palace.

line_text: Now tell me, brother Clarence, what think you
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of this new marriage with the Lady Grey?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hath not our brother made a worthy choice?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Alas, you know, 'tis far from hence to France;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How could he stay till Warwick made return?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lords, forbear this talk; here comes the king.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And his well-chosen bride.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I mind to tell him plainly what I think.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, brother of Clarence, how like you our choice,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That you stand pensive, as half malcontent?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As well as Lewis of France, or the Earl of Warwick,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which are so weak of courage and in judgment
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That they'll take no offence at our abuse.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Suppose they take offence without a cause,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They are but Lewis and Warwick: I am Edward,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Your king and Warwick's, and must have my will.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And shall have your will, because our king:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet hasty marriage seldom proveth well.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yea, brother Richard, are you offended too?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Not I:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No, God forbid that I should wish them sever'd
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whom God hath join'd together; ay, and 'twere pity
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To sunder them that yoke so well together.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Setting your scorns and your mislike aside,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Tell me some reason why the Lady Grey
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Should not become my wife and England's queen.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And you too, Somerset and Montague,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Speak freely what you think.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then this is mine opinion: that King Lewis
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Becomes your enemy, for mocking him
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: About the marriage of the Lady Bona.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And Warwick, doing what you gave in charge,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is now dishonoured by this new marriage.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What if both Lewis and Warwick be appeased
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By such invention as I can devise?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet, to have join'd with France in such alliance
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Would more have strengthen'd this our commonwealth
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Gainst foreign storms than any home-bred marriage.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, knows not Montague that of itself
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: England is safe, if true within itself?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But the safer when 'tis back'd with France.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Tis better using France than trusting France:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let us be back'd with God and with the seas
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which He hath given for fence impregnable,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And with their helps only defend ourselves;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In them and in ourselves our safety lies.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For this one speech Lord Hastings well deserves
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To have the heir of the Lord Hungerford.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, what of that? it was my will and grant;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And for this once my will shall stand for law.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And yet methinks your grace hath not done well,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To give the heir and daughter of Lord Scales
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unto the brother of your loving bride;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She better would have fitted me or Clarence:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But in your bride you bury brotherhood.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or else you would not have bestow'd the heir
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of the Lord Bonville on your new wife's son,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And leave your brothers to go speed elsewhere.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Alas, poor Clarence! is it for a wife
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That thou art malcontent? I will provide thee.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In choosing for yourself, you show'd your judgment,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which being shallow, you give me leave
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To play the broker in mine own behalf;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And to that end I shortly mind to leave you.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Leave me, or tarry, Edward will be king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And not be tied unto his brother's will.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lords, before it pleased his majesty
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To raise my state to title of a queen,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Do me but right, and you must all confess
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That I was not ignoble of descent;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And meaner than myself have had like fortune.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But as this title honours me and mine,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So your dislike, to whom I would be pleasing,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Doth cloud my joys with danger and with sorrow.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My love, forbear to fawn upon their frowns:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What danger or what sorrow can befall thee,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So long as Edward is thy constant friend,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And their true sovereign, whom they must obey?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nay, whom they shall obey, and love thee too,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unless they seek for hatred at my hands;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which if they do, yet will I keep thee safe,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And they shall feel the vengeance of my wrath.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, messenger, what letters or what news
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: From France?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My sovereign liege, no letters; and few words,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But such as I, without your special pardon,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Dare not relate.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Go to, we pardon thee: therefore, in brief,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Tell me their words as near as thou canst guess them.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What answer makes King Lewis unto our letters?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: At my depart, these were his very words:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Go tell false Edward, thy supposed king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That Lewis of France is sending over masquers
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To revel it with him and his new bride.'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is Lewis so brave? belike he thinks me Henry.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But what said Lady Bona to my marriage?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: These were her words, utter'd with mad disdain:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Tell him, in hope he'll prove a widower shortly,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll wear the willow garland for his sake.'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I blame not her, she could say little less;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: She had the wrong. But what said Henry's queen?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For I have heard that she was there in place.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Tell him,' quoth she, 'my mourning weeds are done,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I am ready to put armour on.'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Belike she minds to play the Amazon.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But what said Warwick to these injuries?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He, more incensed against your majesty
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Than all the rest, discharged me with these words:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Tell him from me that he hath done me wrong,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And therefore I'll uncrown him ere't be long.'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ha! durst the traitor breathe out so proud words?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Well I will arm me, being thus forewarn'd:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They shall have wars and pay for their presumption.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But say, is Warwick friends with Margaret?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, gracious sovereign; they are so link'd in
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: friendship
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That young Prince Edward marries Warwick's daughter.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Belike the elder; Clarence will have the younger.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, brother king, farewell, and sit you fast,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For I will hence to Warwick's other daughter;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That, though I want a kingdom, yet in marriage
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I may not prove inferior to yourself.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You that love me and Warwick, follow me.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My thoughts aim at a further matter; I
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Stay not for the love of Edward, but the crown.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Clarence and Somerset both gone to Warwick!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet am I arm'd against the worst can happen;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And haste is needful in this desperate case.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Pembroke and Stafford, you in our behalf
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Go levy men, and make prepare for war;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They are already, or quickly will be landed:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Myself in person will straight follow you.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, ere I go, Hastings and Montague,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Resolve my doubt. You twain, of all the rest,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Are near to Warwick by blood and by alliance:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Tell me if you love Warwick more than me?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If it be so, then both depart to him;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I rather wish you foes than hollow friends:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But if you mind to hold your true obedience,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Give me assurance with some friendly vow,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That I may never have you in suspect.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So God help Montague as he proves true!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And Hastings as he favours Edward's cause!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, brother Richard, will you stand by us?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, in despite of all that shall withstand you.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, so! then am I sure of victory.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now therefore let us hence; and lose no hour,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till we meet Warwick with his foreign power.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Trust me, my lord, all hitherto goes well;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: The common people by numbers swarm to us.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: But see where Somerset and Clarence come!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: Speak suddenly, my lords, are we all friends?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: Fear not that, my lord.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: Then, gentle Clarence, welcome unto Warwick;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: And welcome, Somerset: I hold it cowardice
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: To rest mistrustful where a noble heart
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: Hath pawn'd an open hand in sign of love;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: Else might I think that Clarence, Edward's brother,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: Were but a feigned friend to our proceedings:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: But welcome, sweet Clarence; my daughter shall be thine.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: And now what rests but, in night's coverture,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: Thy brother being carelessly encamp'd,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: His soldiers lurking in the towns about,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: And but attended by a simple guard,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: We may surprise and take him at our pleasure?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: Our scouts have found the adventure very easy:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: That as Ulysses and stout Diomede
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: With sleight and manhood stole to Rhesus' tents,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: And brought from thence the Thracian fatal steeds,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: So we, well cover'd with the night's black mantle,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: At unawares may beat down Edward's guard
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: And seize himself; I say not, slaughter him,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: For I intend but only to surprise him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: You that will follow me to this attempt,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: Applaud the name of Henry with your leader.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: Why, then, let's on our way in silent sort:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: For Warwick and his friends, God and Saint George!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A plain in Warwickshire.

line_text: Come on, my masters, each man take his stand:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: The king by this is set him down to sleep.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: What, will he not to bed?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Why, no; for he hath made a solemn vow
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Never to lie and take his natural rest
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Till Warwick or himself be quite suppress'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: To-morrow then belike shall be the day,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: If Warwick be so near as men report.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: But say, I pray, what nobleman is that
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: That with the king here resteth in his tent?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: 'Tis the Lord Hastings, the king's chiefest friend.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: O, is it so? But why commands the king
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: That his chief followers lodge in towns about him,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: While he himself keeps in the cold field?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: 'Tis the more honour, because more dangerous.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Ay, but give me worship and quietness;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: I like it better than a dangerous honour.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: If Warwick knew in what estate he stands,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: 'Tis to be doubted he would waken him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Unless our halberds did shut up his passage.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Ay, wherefore else guard we his royal tent,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: But to defend his person from night-foes?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: This is his tent; and see where stand his guard.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Courage, my masters! honour now or never!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: But follow me, and Edward shall be ours.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Who goes there?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Stay, or thou diest!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: What are they that fly there?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Richard and Hastings: let them go; here is The duke.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: The duke! Why, Warwick, when we parted,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Thou call'dst me king.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Ay, but the case is alter'd:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: When you disgraced me in my embassade,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Then I degraded you from being king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: And come now to create you Duke of York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Alas! how should you govern any kingdom,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: That know not how to use ambassadors,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Nor how to be contented with one wife,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Nor how to use your brothers brotherly,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Nor how to study for the people's welfare,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Nor how to shroud yourself from enemies?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Yea, brother of Clarence, are thou here too?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Nay, then I see that Edward needs must down.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Yet, Warwick, in despite of all mischance,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Of thee thyself and all thy complices,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Edward will always bear himself as king:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Though fortune's malice overthrow my state,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: My mind exceeds the compass of her wheel.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Then, for his mind, be Edward England's king:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: But Henry now shall wear the English crown,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: And be true king indeed, thou but the shadow.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: My Lord of Somerset, at my request,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: See that forthwith Duke Edward be convey'd
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Unto my brother, Archbishop of York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: When I have fought with Pembroke and his fellows,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: I'll follow you, and tell what answer
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Lewis and the Lady Bona send to him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Now, for a while farewell, good Duke of York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: What fates impose, that men must needs abide;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: It boots not to resist both wind and tide.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: What now remains, my lords, for us to do
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: But march to London with our soldiers?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Ay, that's the first thing that we have to do;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: To free King Henry from imprisonment
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: And see him seated in the regal throne.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Edward's camp, near Warwick.

line_text: Madam, what makes you in this sudden change?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why brother Rivers, are you yet to learn
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What late misfortune is befall'n King Edward?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What! loss of some pitch'd battle against Warwick?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No, but the loss of his own royal person.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then is my sovereign slain?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, almost slain, for he is taken prisoner,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Either betray'd by falsehood of his guard
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or by his foe surprised at unawares:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, as I further have to understand,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is new committed to the Bishop of York,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Fell Warwick's brother and by that our foe.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: These news I must confess are full of grief;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet, gracious madam, bear it as you may:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Warwick may lose, that now hath won the day.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till then fair hope must hinder life's decay.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I the rather wean me from despair
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For love of Edward's offspring in my womb:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This is it that makes me bridle passion
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And bear with mildness my misfortune's cross;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, ay, for this I draw in many a tear
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And stop the rising of blood-sucking sighs,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lest with my sighs or tears I blast or drown
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: King Edward's fruit, true heir to the English crown.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, madam, where is Warwick then become?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I am inform'd that he comes towards London,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To set the crown once more on Henry's head:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Guess thou the rest; King Edward's friends must down,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, to prevent the tyrant's violence,--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For trust not him that hath once broken faith,--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll hence forthwith unto the sanctuary,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To save at least the heir of Edward's right:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: There shall I rest secure from force and fraud.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, therefore, let us fly while we may fly:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If Warwick take us we are sure to die.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, my Lord Hastings and Sir William Stanley,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Leave off to wonder why I drew you hither,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Into this chiefest thicket of the park.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Thus stands the case: you know our king, my brother,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Is prisoner to the bishop here, at whose hands
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: He hath good usage and great liberty,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: And, often but attended with weak guard,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Comes hunting this way to disport himself.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: I have advertised him by secret means
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: That if about this hour he make his way
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Under the colour of his usual game,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: He shall here find his friends with horse and men
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: To set him free from his captivity.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: This way, my lord; for this way lies the game.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Nay, this way, man: see where the huntsmen stand.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Now, brother of Gloucester, Lord Hastings, and the rest,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Stand you thus close, to steal the bishop's deer?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Brother, the time and case requireth haste:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Your horse stands ready at the park-corner.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: But whither shall we then?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: To Lynn, my lord,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: And ship from thence to Flanders.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Well guess'd, believe me; for that was my meaning.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Stanley, I will requite thy forwardness.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: But wherefore stay we? 'tis no time to talk.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Huntsman, what say'st thou? wilt thou go along?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Better do so than tarry and be hang'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Come then, away; let's ha' no more ado.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Bishop, farewell: shield thee from Warwick's frown;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: And pray that I may repossess the crown.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

line_text: Master lieutenant, now that God and friends
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have shaken Edward from the regal seat,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And turn'd my captive state to liberty,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My fear to hope, my sorrows unto joys,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: At our enlargement what are thy due fees?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Subjects may challenge nothing of their sovereigns;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But if an humble prayer may prevail,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I then crave pardon of your majesty.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For what, lieutenant? for well using me?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nay, be thou sure I'll well requite thy kindness,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For that it made my imprisonment a pleasure;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, such a pleasure as incaged birds
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Conceive when after many moody thoughts
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: At last by notes of household harmony
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They quite forget their loss of liberty.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, Warwick, after God, thou set'st me free,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And chiefly therefore I thank God and thee;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He was the author, thou the instrument.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Therefore, that I may conquer fortune's spite
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By living low, where fortune cannot hurt me,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And that the people of this blessed land
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: May not be punish'd with my thwarting stars,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Warwick, although my head still wear the crown,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I here resign my government to thee,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For thou art fortunate in all thy deeds.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Your grace hath still been famed for virtuous;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And now may seem as wise as virtuous,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By spying and avoiding fortune's malice,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For few men rightly temper with the stars:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet in this one thing let me blame your grace,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For choosing me when Clarence is in place.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No, Warwick, thou art worthy of the sway,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To whom the heavens in thy nativity
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Adjudged an olive branch and laurel crown,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As likely to be blest in peace and war;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And therefore I yield thee my free consent.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I choose Clarence only for protector.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Warwick and Clarence give me both your hands:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now join your hands, and with your hands your hearts,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That no dissension hinder government:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I make you both protectors of this land,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: While I myself will lead a private life
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And in devotion spend my latter days,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To sin's rebuke and my Creator's praise.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What answers Clarence to his sovereign's will?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That he consents, if Warwick yield consent;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For on thy fortune I repose myself.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, then, though loath, yet must I be content:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We'll yoke together, like a double shadow
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To Henry's body, and supply his place;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I mean, in bearing weight of government,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: While he enjoys the honour and his ease.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, Clarence, now then it is more than needful
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Forthwith that Edward be pronounced a traitor,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And all his lands and goods be confiscate.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What else? and that succession be determined.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, therein Clarence shall not want his part.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, with the first of all your chief affairs,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let me entreat, for I command no more,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That Margaret your queen and my son Edward
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be sent for, to return from France with speed;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For, till I see them here, by doubtful fear
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My joy of liberty is half eclipsed.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It shall be done, my sovereign, with all speed.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My Lord of Somerset, what youth is that,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of whom you seem to have so tender care?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My liege, it is young Henry, earl of Richmond.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come hither, England's hope.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If secret powers
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Suggest but truth to my divining thoughts,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This pretty lad will prove our country's bliss.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His looks are full of peaceful majesty,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His head by nature framed to wear a crown,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His hand to wield a sceptre, and himself
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Likely in time to bless a regal throne.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Make much of him, my lords, for this is he
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Must help you more than you are hurt by me.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What news, my friend?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That Edward is escaped from your brother,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And fled, as he hears since, to Burgundy.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Unsavoury news! but how made he escape?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He was convey'd by Richard Duke of Gloucester
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And the Lord Hastings, who attended him
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In secret ambush on the forest side
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And from the bishop's huntsmen rescued him;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For hunting was his daily exercise.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My brother was too careless of his charge.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But let us hence, my sovereign, to provide
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A salve for any sore that may betide.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lord, I like not of this flight of Edward's;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For doubtless Burgundy will yield him help,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And we shall have more wars before 't be long.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As Henry's late presaging prophecy
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Did glad my heart with hope of this young Richmond,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So doth my heart misgive me, in these conflicts
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What may befall him, to his harm and ours:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Therefore, Lord Oxford, to prevent the worst,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Forthwith we'll send him hence to Brittany,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till storms be past of civil enmity.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, for if Edward repossess the crown,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Tis like that Richmond with the rest shall down.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It shall be so; he shall to Brittany.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, therefore, let's about it speedily.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, brother Richard, Lord Hastings, and the rest,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet thus far fortune maketh us amends,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And says that once more I shall interchange
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My waned state for Henry's regal crown.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Well have we pass'd and now repass'd the seas
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And brought desired help from Burgundy:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What then remains, we being thus arrived
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: From Ravenspurgh haven before the gates of York,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But that we enter, as into our dukedom?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The gates made fast! Brother, I like not this;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For many men that stumble at the threshold
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Are well foretold that danger lurks within.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Tush, man, abodements must not now affright us:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By fair or foul means we must enter in,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For hither will our friends repair to us.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My liege, I'll knock once more to summon them.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My lords, we were forewarned of your coming,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And shut the gates for safety of ourselves;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For now we owe allegiance unto Henry.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, master mayor, if Henry be your king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet Edward at the least is Duke of York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: True, my good lord; I know you for no less.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, and I challenge nothing but my dukedom,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As being well content with that alone.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He'll soon find means to make the body follow.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, master mayor, why stand you in a doubt?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Open the gates; we are King Henry's friends.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, say you so? the gates shall then be open'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A wise stout captain, and soon persuaded!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The good old man would fain that all were well,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So 'twere not 'long of him; but being enter'd,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I doubt not, I, but we shall soon persuade
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Both him and all his brothers unto reason.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So, master mayor: these gates must not be shut
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But in the night or in the time of war.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What! fear not, man, but yield me up the keys;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For Edward will defend the town and thee,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And all those friends that deign to follow me.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Brother, this is Sir John Montgomery,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Our trusty friend, unless I be deceived.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Welcome, Sir John! But why come you in arms?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To help King Edward in his time of storm,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As every loyal subject ought to do.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thanks, good Montgomery; but we now forget
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Our title to the crown and only claim
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Our dukedom till God please to send the rest.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then fare you well, for I will hence again:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I came to serve a king and not a duke.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Drummer, strike up, and let us march away.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nay, stay, Sir John, awhile, and we'll debate
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By what safe means the crown may be recover'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What talk you of debating? in few words,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If you'll not here proclaim yourself our king,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll leave you to your fortune and be gone
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To keep them back that come to succor you:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why shall we fight, if you pretend no title?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, brother, wherefore stand you on nice points?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: When we grow stronger, then we'll make our claim:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Till then, 'tis wisdom to conceal our meaning.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Away with scrupulous wit! now arms must rule.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And fearless minds climb soonest unto crowns.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Brother, we will proclaim you out of hand:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The bruit thereof will bring you many friends.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then be it as you will; for 'tis my right,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And Henry but usurps the diadem.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, now my sovereign speaketh like himself;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And now will I be Edward's champion.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sound trumpet; Edward shall be here proclaim'd:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, fellow-soldier, make thou proclamation.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Edward the Fourth, by the grace of God, king of
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: England and France, and lord of Ireland, &c.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And whosoe'er gainsays King Edward's right,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By this I challenge him to single fight.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Long live Edward the Fourth!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thanks, brave Montgomery; and thanks unto you all:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If fortune serve me, I'll requite this kindness.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, for this night, let's harbour here in York;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And when the morning sun shall raise his car
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Above the border of this horizon,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We'll forward towards Warwick and his mates;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For well I wot that Henry is no soldier.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, froward Clarence! how evil it beseems thee
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To flatter Henry and forsake thy brother!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet, as we may, we'll meet both thee and Warwick.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come on, brave soldiers: doubt not of the day,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, that once gotten, doubt not of large pay.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What counsel, lords? Edward from Belgia,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With hasty Germans and blunt Hollanders,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hath pass'd in safety through the narrow seas,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And with his troops doth march amain to London;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And many giddy people flock to him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let's levy men, and beat him back again.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A little fire is quickly trodden out;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which, being suffer'd, rivers cannot quench.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In Warwickshire I have true-hearted friends,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Not mutinous in peace, yet bold in war;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Those will I muster up: and thou, son Clarence,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shalt stir up in Suffolk, Norfolk, and in Kent,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The knights and gentlemen to come with thee:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou, brother Montague, in Buckingham,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Northampton and in Leicestershire, shalt find
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Men well inclined to hear what thou command'st:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thou, brave Oxford, wondrous well beloved,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In Oxfordshire shalt muster up thy friends.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My sovereign, with the loving citizens,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Like to his island girt in with the ocean,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or modest Dian circled with her nymphs,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall rest in London till we come to him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Fair lords, take leave and stand not to reply.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Farewell, my sovereign.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Farewell, my Hector, and my Troy's true hope.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: In sign of truth, I kiss your highness' hand.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Well-minded Clarence, be thou fortunate!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Comfort, my lord; and so I take my leave.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thus I seal my truth, and bid adieu.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sweet Oxford, and my loving Montague,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And all at once, once more a happy farewell.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Farewell, sweet lords: let's meet at Coventry.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here at the palace I will rest awhile.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Cousin of Exeter, what thinks your lordship?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Methinks the power that Edward hath in field
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Should not be able to encounter mine.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The doubt is that he will seduce the rest.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That's not my fear; my meed hath got me fame:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I have not stopp'd mine ears to their demands,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor posted off their suits with slow delays;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My pity hath been balm to heal their wounds,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My mildness hath allay'd their swelling griefs,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My mercy dried their water-flowing tears;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I have not been desirous of their wealth,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor much oppress'd them with great subsidies.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nor forward of revenge, though they much err'd:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then why should they love Edward more than me?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: No, Exeter, these graces challenge grace:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And when the lion fawns upon the lamb,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The lamb will never cease to follow him.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hark, hark, my lord! what shouts are these?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Seize on the shame-faced Henry, bear him hence;
