play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And once again proclaim us King of England.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You are the fount that makes small brooks to flow:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now stops thy spring; my sea sha$l suck them dry,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And swell so much the higher by their ebb.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hence with him to the Tower; let him not speak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, lords, towards Coventry bend we our course
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where peremptory Warwick now remains:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The sun shines hot; and, if we use delay,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Cold biting winter mars our hoped-for hay.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Away betimes, before his forces join,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And take the great-grown traitor unawares:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Brave warriors, march amain towards Coventry.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where is the post that came from valiant Oxford?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How far hence is thy lord, mine honest fellow?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By this at Dunsmore, marching hitherward.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: How far off is our brother Montague?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where is the post that came from Montague?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: By this at Daintry, with a puissant troop.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Say, Somerville, what says my loving son?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, by thy guess, how nigh is Clarence now?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: At Southam I did leave him with his forces,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And do expect him here some two hours hence.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then Clarence is at hand, I hear his drum.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: It is not his, my lord; here Southam lies:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The drum your honour hears marcheth from Warwick.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who should that be? belike, unlook'd-for friends.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: They are at hand, and you shall quickly know.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Go, trumpet, to the walls, and sound a parle.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: See how the surly Warwick mans the wall!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O unbid spite! is sportful Edward come?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where slept our scouts, or how are they seduced,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That we could hear no news of his repair?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now, Warwick, wilt thou ope the city gates,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Speak gentle words and humbly bend thy knee,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Call Edward king and at his hands beg mercy?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And he shall pardon thee these outrages.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nay, rather, wilt thou draw thy forces hence,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Confess who set thee up and pluck'd thee own,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Call Warwick patron and be penitent?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thou shalt still remain the Duke of York.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I thought, at least, he would have said the king;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or did he make the jest against his will?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is not a dukedom, sir, a goodly gift?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, by my faith, for a poor earl to give:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll do thee service for so good a gift.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Twas I that gave the kingdom to thy brother.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why then 'tis mine, if but by Warwick's gift.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou art no Atlas for so great a weight:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And weakling, Warwick takes his gift again;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And Henry is my king, Warwick his subject.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But Warwick's king is Edward's prisoner:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, gallant Warwick, do but answer this:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What is the body when the head is off?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Alas, that Warwick had no more forecast,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But, whiles he thought to steal the single ten,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The king was slily finger'd from the deck!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You left poor Henry at the Bishop's palace,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, ten to one, you'll meet him in the Tower.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Tis even so; yet you are Warwick still.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, Warwick, take the time; kneel down, kneel down:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Nay, when? strike now, or else the iron cools.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I had rather chop this hand off at a blow,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And with the other fling it at thy face,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Than bear so low a sail, to strike to thee.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sail how thou canst, have wind and tide thy friend,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This hand, fast wound about thy coal-black hair
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall, whiles thy head is warm and new cut off,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Write in the dust this sentence with thy blood,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Wind-changing Warwick now can change no more.'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O cheerful colours! see where Oxford comes!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Oxford, Oxford, for Lancaster!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The gates are open, let us enter too.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So other foes may set upon our backs.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Stand we in good array; for they no doubt
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Will issue out again and bid us battle:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If not, the city being but of small defence,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We'll quickly rouse the traitors in the same.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O, welcome, Oxford! for we want thy help.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Montague, Montague, for Lancaster!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou and thy brother both shall buy this treason
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Even with the dearest blood your bodies bear.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The harder match'd, the greater victory:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My mind presageth happy gain and conquest.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Somerset, Somerset, for Lancaster!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Two of thy name, both Dukes of Somerset,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have sold their lives unto the house of York;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thou shalt be the third if this sword hold.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And lo, where George of Clarence sweeps along,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Of force enough to bid his brother battle;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With whom an upright zeal to right prevails
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: More than the nature of a brother's love!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come, Clarence, come; thou wilt, if Warwick call.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Father of Warwick, know you what this means?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Look here, I throw my infamy at thee
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I will not ruinate my father's house,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Who gave his blood to lime the stones together,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And set up Lancaster. Why, trow'st thou, Warwick,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That Clarence is so harsh, so blunt, unnatural,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To bend the fatal instruments of war
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Against his brother and his lawful king?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Perhaps thou wilt object my holy oath:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To keep that oath were more impiety
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Than Jephthah's, when he sacrificed his daughter.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I am so sorry for my trespass made
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That, to deserve well at my brother's hands,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I here proclaim myself thy mortal foe,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With resolution, wheresoe'er I meet thee--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As I will meet thee, if thou stir abroad--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To plague thee for thy foul misleading me.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And so, proud-hearted Warwick, I defy thee,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And to my brother turn my blushing cheeks.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Pardon me, Edward, I will make amends:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, Richard, do not frown upon my faults,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For I will henceforth be no more unconstant.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now welcome more, and ten times more beloved,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Than if thou never hadst deserved our hate.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Welcome, good Clarence; this is brotherlike.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O passing traitor, perjured and unjust!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What, Warwick, wilt thou leave the town and fight?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or shall we beat the stones about thine ears?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Alas, I am not coop'd here for defence!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I will away towards Barnet presently,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And bid thee battle, Edward, if thou darest.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yes, Warwick, Edward dares, and leads the way.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lords, to the field; Saint George and victory!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So, lie thou there: die thou, and die our fear;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: For Warwick was a bug that fear'd us all.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Now, Montague, sit fast; I seek for thee,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: That Warwick's bones may keep thine company.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Ah, who is nigh? come to me, friend or foe,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: And tell me who is victor, York or Warwick?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Why ask I that? my mangled body shows,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: My blood, my want of strength, my sick heart shows.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: That I must yield my body to the earth
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: And, by my fall, the conquest to my foe.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Thus yields the cedar to the axe's edge,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Whose arms gave shelter to the princely eagle,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Under whose shade the ramping lion slept,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Whose top-branch overpeer'd Jove's spreading tree
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: And kept low shrubs from winter's powerful wind.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: These eyes, that now are dimm'd with death's black veil,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Have been as piercing as the mid-day sun,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: To search the secret treasons of the world:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: The wrinkles in my brows, now filled with blood,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Were liken'd oft to kingly sepulchres;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: For who lived king, but I could dig his grave?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: And who durst mine when Warwick bent his brow?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Lo, now my glory smear'd in dust and blood!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: My parks, my walks, my manors that I had.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Even now forsake me, and of all my lands
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Is nothing left me but my body's length.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Why, what is pomp, rule, reign, but earth and dust?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: And, live we how we can, yet die we must.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Ah, Warwick, Warwick! wert thou as we are.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: We might recover all our loss again;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: The queen from France hath brought a puissant power:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Even now we heard the news: ah, could'st thou fly!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Why, then I would not fly. Ah, Montague,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: If thou be there, sweet brother, take my hand.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: And with thy lips keep in my soul awhile!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Thou lovest me not; for, brother, if thou didst,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Thy tears would wash this cold congealed blood
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: That glues my lips and will not let me speak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Come quickly, Montague, or I am dead.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Ah, Warwick! Montague hath breathed his last;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: And to the latest gasp cried out for Warwick,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: And said 'Commend me to my valiant brother.'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: And more he would have said, and more he spoke,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Which sounded like a clamour in a vault,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: That mought not be distinguished; but at last
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: I well might hear, delivered with a groan,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: 'O, farewell, Warwick!'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Sweet rest his soul! Fly, lords, and save yourselves;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: For Warwick bids you all farewell to meet in heaven.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Away, away, to meet the queen's great power!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE II.  A field of battle near Barnet.

line_text: Thus far our fortune keeps an upward course,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And we are graced with wreaths of victory.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But, in the midst of this bright-shining day,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I spy a black, suspicious, threatening cloud,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That will encounter with our glorious sun,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ere he attain his easeful western bed:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I mean, my lords, those powers that the queen
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hath raised in Gallia have arrived our coast
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And, as we hear, march on to fight with us.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: A little gale will soon disperse that cloud
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And blow it to the source from whence it came:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The very beams will dry those vapours up,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For every cloud engenders not a storm.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The queen is valued thirty thousand strong,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And Somerset, with Oxford fled to her:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: If she have time to breathe be well assured
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Her faction will be full as strong as ours.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: We are advertised by our loving friends
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That they do hold their course toward Tewksbury:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: We, having now the best at Barnet field,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Will thither straight, for willingness rids way;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And, as we march, our strength will be augmented
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: In every county as we go along.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Strike up the drum; cry 'Courage!' and away.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE III.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Great lords, wise men ne'er sit and wail their loss,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But cheerly seek how to redress their harms.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What though the mast be now blown overboard,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The cable broke, the holding-anchor lost,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And half our sailors swallow'd in the flood?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Yet lives our pilot still. Is't meet that he
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Should leave the helm and like a fearful lad
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With tearful eyes add water to the sea
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And give more strength to that which hath too much,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whiles, in his moan, the ship splits on the rock,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which industry and courage might have saved?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, what a shame! ah, what a fault were this!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Say Warwick was our anchor; what of that?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And Montague our topmost; what of him?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Our slaughter'd friends the tackles; what of these?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, is not Oxford here another anchor?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And Somerset another goodly mast?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The friends of France our shrouds and tacklings?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, though unskilful, why not Ned and I
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For once allow'd the skilful pilot's charge?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: We will not from the helm to sit and weep,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But keep our course, though the rough wind say no,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: From shelves and rocks that threaten us with wreck.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: As good to chide the waves as speak them fair.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And what is Edward but ruthless sea?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What Clarence but a quicksand of deceit?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And Richard but a ragged fatal rock?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: All these the enemies to our poor bark.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Say you can swim; alas, 'tis but a while!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Tread on the sand; why, there you quickly sink:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Bestride the rock; the tide will wash you off,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Or else you famish; that's a threefold death.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This speak I, lords, to let you understand,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If case some one of you would fly from us,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That there's no hoped-for mercy with the brothers
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: More than with ruthless waves, with sands and rocks.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, courage then! what cannot be avoided
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Twere childish weakness to lament or fear.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Methinks a woman of this valiant spirit
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Should, if a coward heard her speak these words,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Infuse his breast with magnanimity
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And make him, naked, foil a man at arms.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I speak not this as doubting any here
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For did I but suspect a fearful man
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: He should have leave to go away betimes,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lest in our need he might infect another
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And make him of like spirit to himself.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If any such be here--as God forbid!--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let him depart before we need his help.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Women and children of so high a courage,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And warriors faint! why, 'twere perpetual shame.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O brave young prince! thy famous grandfather
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Doth live again in thee: long mayst thou live
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To bear his image and renew his glories!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And he that will not fight for such a hope.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Go home to bed, and like the owl by day,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If he arise, be mock'd and wonder'd at.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thanks, gentle Somerset; sweet Oxford, thanks.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And take his thanks that yet hath nothing else.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Prepare you, lords, for Edward is at hand.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ready to fight; therefore be resolute.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I thought no less: it is his policy
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To haste thus fast, to find us unprovided.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But he's deceived; we are in readiness.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This cheers my heart, to see your forwardness.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Here pitch our battle; hence we will not budge.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Brave followers, yonder stands the thorny wood,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which, by the heavens' assistance and your strength,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Must by the roots be hewn up yet ere night.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I need not add more fuel to your fire,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For well I wot ye blaze to burn them out
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Give signal to the fight, and to it, lords!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Lords, knights, and gentlemen, what I should say
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My tears gainsay; for every word I speak,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ye see, I drink the water of mine eyes.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Therefore, no more but this: Henry, your sovereign,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Is prisoner to the foe; his state usurp'd,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His realm a slaughter-house, his subjects slain,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: His statutes cancell'd and his treasure spent;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And yonder is the wolf that makes this spoil.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: You fight in justice: then, in God's name, lords,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be valiant and give signal to the fight.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now here a period of tumultuous broils.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Away with Oxford to Hames Castle straight:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For Somerset, off with his guilty head.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Go, bear them hence; I will not hear them speak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For my part, I'll not trouble thee with words.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Nor I, but stoop with patience to my fortune.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So part we sadly in this troublous world,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To meet with joy in sweet Jerusalem.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Is proclamation made, that who finds Edward
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Shall have a high reward, and he his life?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: It is: and lo, where youthful Edward comes!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Bring forth the gallant, let us hear him speak.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What! can so young a thorn begin to prick?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Edward, what satisfaction canst thou make
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For bearing arms, for stirring up my subjects,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And all the trouble thou hast turn'd me to?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Speak like a subject, proud ambitious York!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Suppose that I am now my father's mouth;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Resign thy chair, and where I stand kneel thou,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Whilst I propose the selfsame words to thee,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Which traitor, thou wouldst have me answer to.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ah, that thy father had been so resolved!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: That you might still have worn the petticoat,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And ne'er have stol'n the breech from Lancaster.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Let AEsop fable in a winter's night;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: His currish riddles sort not with this place.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: By heaven, brat, I'll plague ye for that word.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ay, thou wast born to be a plague to men.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: For God's sake, take away this captive scold.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Nay, take away this scolding crookback rather.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Peace, wilful boy, or I will charm your tongue.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Untutor'd lad, thou art too malapert.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I know my duty; you are all undutiful:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Lascivious Edward, and thou perjured George,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And thou mis-shapen Dick, I tell ye all
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I am your better, traitors as ye are:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And thou usurp'st my father's right and mine.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Take that, thou likeness of this railer here.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Sprawl'st thou? take that, to end thy agony.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And there's for twitting me with perjury.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O, kill me too!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Marry, and shall.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hold, Richard, hold; for we have done too much.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Why should she live, to fill the world with words?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What, doth she swoon? use means for her recovery.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Clarence, excuse me to the king my brother;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: I'll hence to London on a serious matter:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ere ye come there, be sure to hear some news.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What? what?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The Tower, the Tower.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: O Ned, sweet Ned! speak to thy mother, boy!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Canst thou not speak? O traitors! murderers!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: They that stabb'd Caesar shed no blood at all,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Did not offend, nor were not worthy blame,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: If this foul deed were by to equal it:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: He was a man; this, in respect, a child:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And men ne'er spend their fury on a child.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What's worse than murderer, that I may name it?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: No, no, my heart will burst, and if I speak:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And I will speak, that so my heart may burst.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Butchers and villains! bloody cannibals!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: How sweet a plant have you untimely cropp'd!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: You have no children, butchers! if you had,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: The thought of them would have stirr'd up remorse:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: But if you ever chance to have a child,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Look in his youth to have him so cut off
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: As, deathmen, you have rid this sweet young prince!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Away with her; go, bear her hence perforce.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Nay, never bear me hence, dispatch me here,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Here sheathe thy sword, I'll pardon thee my death:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What, wilt thou not? then, Clarence, do it thou.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: By heaven, I will not do thee so much ease.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Good Clarence, do; sweet Clarence, do thou do it.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Didst thou not hear me swear I would not do it?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Ay, but thou usest to forswear thyself:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: 'Twas sin before, but now 'tis charity.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: What, wilt thou not? Where is that devil's butcher,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Hard-favour'd Richard? Richard, where art thou?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Thou art not here: murder is thy alms-deed;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Petitioners for blood thou ne'er put'st back.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Away, I say; I charge ye, bear her hence.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: So come to you and yours, as to this Prince!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Where's Richard gone?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To London, all in post; and, as I guess,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: To make a bloody supper in the Tower.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: He's sudden, if a thing comes in his head.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Now march we hence: discharge the common sort
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: With pay and thanks, and let's away to London
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: And see our gentle queen how well she fares:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: By this, I hope, she hath a son for me.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
scene_title: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.

line_text: Good day, my lord. What, at your book so hard?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, my good lord:--my lord, I should say rather;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Tis sin to flatter; 'good' was little better:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'Good Gloucester' and 'good devil' were alike,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And both preposterous; therefore, not 'good lord.'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sirrah, leave us to ourselves: we must confer.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So flies the reckless shepherd from the wolf;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: So first the harmless sheep doth yield his fleece
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And next his throat unto the butcher's knife.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What scene of death hath Roscius now to act?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The thief doth fear each bush an officer.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The bird that hath been limed in a bush,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With trembling wings misdoubteth every bush;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And I, the hapless male to one sweet bird,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have now the fatal object in my eye
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Where my poor young was limed, was caught and kill'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, what a peevish fool was that of Crete,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That taught his son the office of a fowl!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: An yet, for all his wings, the fool was drown'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I, Daedalus; my poor boy, Icarus;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy father, Minos, that denied our course;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The sun that sear'd the wings of my sweet boy
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy brother Edward, and thyself the sea
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Whose envious gulf did swallow up his life.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ah, kill me with thy weapon, not with words!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: My breast can better brook thy dagger's point
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Than can my ears that tragic history.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But wherefore dost thou come? is't for my life?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Think'st thou I am an executioner?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: A persecutor, I am sure, thou art:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If murdering innocents be executing,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Why, then thou art an executioner.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy son I kill'd for his presumption.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hadst thou been kill'd when first thou didst presume,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou hadst not lived to kill a son of mine.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And thus I prophesy, that many a thousand,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Which now mistrust no parcel of my fear,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And many an old man's sigh and many a widow's,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And many an orphan's water-standing eye--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Men for their sons, wives for their husbands,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And orphans for their parents timeless death--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Shall rue the hour that ever thou wast born.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The owl shriek'd at thy birth,--an evil sign;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The night-crow cried, aboding luckless time;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Dogs howl'd, and hideous tempest shook down trees;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The raven rook'd her on the chimney's top,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And chattering pies in dismal discords sung.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thy mother felt more than a mother's pain,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, yet brought forth less than a mother's hope,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To wit, an indigested and deformed lump,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Not like the fruit of such a goodly tree.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Teeth hadst thou in thy head when thou wast born,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: To signify thou camest to bite the world:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, if the rest be true which I have heard,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thou camest--
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll hear no more: die, prophet in thy speech:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For this amongst the rest, was I ordain'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ay, and for much more slaughter after this.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: God forgive my sins, and pardon thee!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What, will the aspiring blood of Lancaster
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sink in the ground? I thought it would have mounted.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: See how my sword weeps for the poor king's death!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: O, may such purple tears be alway shed
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: From those that wish the downfall of our house!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: If any spark of life be yet remaining,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Down, down to hell; and say I sent thee thither:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I, that have neither pity, love, nor fear.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Indeed, 'tis true that Henry told me of;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For I have often heard my mother say
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I came into the world with my legs forward:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Had I not reason, think ye, to make haste,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And seek their ruin that usurp'd our right?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The midwife wonder'd and the women cried
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 'O, Jesus bless us, he is born with teeth!'
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And so I was; which plainly signified
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That I should snarl and bite and play the dog.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Then, since the heavens have shaped my body so,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Let hell make crook'd my mind to answer it.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I have no brother, I am like no brother;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And this word 'love,' which graybeards call divine,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Be resident in men like one another
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And not in me: I am myself alone.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Clarence, beware; thou keep'st me from the light:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: But I will sort a pitchy day for thee;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For I will buz abroad such prophecies
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That Edward shall be fearful of his life,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And then, to purge his fear, I'll be thy death.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: King Henry and the prince his son are gone:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Clarence, thy turn is next, and then the rest,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Counting myself but bad till I be best.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I'll throw thy body in another room
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And triumph, Henry, in thy day of doom.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: 3 KING HENRY VI
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Once more we sit in England's royal throne,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Re-purchased with the blood of enemies.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What valiant foemen, like to autumn's corn,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have we mow'd down, in tops of all their pride!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Three Dukes of Somerset, threefold renown'd
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For hardy and undoubted champions;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Two Cliffords, as the father and the son,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And two Northumberlands; two braver men
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Ne'er spurr'd their coursers at the trumpet's sound;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With them, the two brave bears, Warwick and Montague,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That in their chains fetter'd the kingly lion
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And made the forest tremble when they roar'd.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thus have we swept suspicion from our seat
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And made our footstool of security.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Come hither, Bess, and let me kiss my boy.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Young Ned, for thee, thine uncles and myself
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Have in our armours watch'd the winter's night,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Went all afoot in summer's scalding heat,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: That thou mightst repossess the crown in peace;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And of our labours thou shalt reap the gain.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For yet I am not look'd on in the world.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: This shoulder was ordain'd so thick to heave;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And heave it shall some weight, or break my back:
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Work thou the way,--and thou shalt execute.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Clarence and Gloucester, love my lovely queen;
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And kiss your princely nephew, brothers both.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: The duty that I owe unto your majesty
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: I seal upon the lips of this sweet babe.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Thanks, noble Clarence; worthy brother, thanks.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And, that I love the tree from whence thou sprang'st,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Witness the loving kiss I give the fruit.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And cried 'all hail!' when as he meant all harm.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Now am I seated as my soul delights,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Having my country's peace and brothers' loves.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: What will your grace have done with Margaret?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Reignier, her father, to the king of France
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Hath pawn'd the Sicils and Jerusalem,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And hither have they sent it for her ransom.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Away with her, and waft her hence to France.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: And now what rests but that we spend the time
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: With stately triumphs, mirthful comic shows,
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Such as befits the pleasure of the court?
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: Sound drums and trumpets! farewell sour annoy!
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth

line_text: For here, I hope, begins our lasting joy.
play_title_long: The Third Part of Henry the Sixth
